snippet: In January, a staff of 50 or more full-time employees will trigger the law’s employer mandate, which has employers weighing the costs of expansion.
abstract: Affordable Care Act, which starting in 2016 requires businesses with 50 or more full-time employees to offer health insurance, has some small businesses rethinking plans for growth; some owners say they cannot afford to cross threshold.
lead_paragraph: In January, a staff of 50 or more full-time employees will trigger the law’s employer mandate, which has employers weighing the costs of expansion.

headline.main: Health Care Law Forces Businesses to Consider Growth’s Costs
headline.print_headline: Health Care Law Leads Business Owners to Rethink Plans for Growth

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
